Barnsley Market
Barnsley has had a market since the Middle Ages.In 1249,the monks were granted a Royal Charter by Henry III,which allowed them to hold a weekly market and annual fair on May Day Green. When the town was redeveloped, in the 1970's, the old open areas disappeared to make way for the new complex. Today the market is a new building consisting of a 2-storey covered hall,a semi-open area and an outdoor market. The indoor market is open weekdays but the other two sections are only open on the traditional market days,
{ Wednesdays, Fridays}and{Saturdays }.
